name: Edge case: user contradicts themselves across turns

userMessages.content: All content should be publicly visible. No login required to read anything. We want maximum reach.
Actually, premium articles should be behind a paywall. Only subscribers can read them. We have free and paid tiers.
Wait, I think a metered approach is better. Everyone can read 5 articles per month for free, then they hit the paywall. But some cornerstone articles should always be free to maximize SEO.
Yes, the metered model with always-free cornerstone articles is what we want. Sorry for going back and forth. Authors should be able to flag articles as cornerstone.

expectedOpenQuestions: How is the 5-article monthly limit tracked (cookies, IP, account)?
Does the meter reset on a calendar month or rolling 30 days?
What content types count toward the meter (articles only, or also videos/podcasts)?
expectedNonGoals: Fully public access model (superseded by metered model)
Strict paywall for all premium content (superseded by metered model)
